description.narrative: By end 2021, populations in targeted communities in priority regions have the knowledge to address the issue of stigma and discrimination for PLWHA and OVC and support community solidarity mechanisms, which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Hiv â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: Pregnant women, children and adolescents in 10 regions access equitable and friendly quality services for prevention, management and treatment of HIV/AIDS and sexually transmitted infections, reproductive health and gender-based violence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, populations in targeted communities in priority regions have the knowledge to address the issue of stigma anddiscrimination for PLWHA and OVC and support community solidarity mechanisms

description.narrative: The strengthening of technical and institutional capacities of community-based organisations, including PLWHA made it possible to implement sensitization activities to fight stigmatization and discrimination contained in the operational plans of the 89 priority health districts in the 13 provinces supported by UNICEF with financial support from the Global Fund. This decentralization effort, based on the five-year micro plans in the Provincial Health Directorates (PHD), allowed to optimize the HIV response through the supply and demand for services for pregnant women, children and youth/adolescents | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/01/2022
